attributes.action: promise to the British people that : a Labour Government will not ratify the European Constitution nor any measures for which it was to have been the enabling framework, without the approval of voters by means of the long-promised Referendum and that pending such approval any initiatives for enactment of related measures shall be rejected by the British Government.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Tony Blair has promised repeatedly that he would not make Britain subject to the European Constitution without seeking the views of voters here. However, those who supposed that the European Constitution had gone away following significant 'No' votes in France and Holland, are mistaken. The arrogant attitude of the Brussels juggernaut is typified by the words of its architect, Giscard d'Estaing:"Let's be clear about this," he said,"the rejection of the constitution was a mistake that will have to be corrected."
